intro: Angraecum robustum, commonly known as the giant angraecum, is a species of orchid native to Madagascar. It is characterized by its large, showy flowers that can reach up to 10 centimeters in diameter. The plant produces long, pendulous inflorescences with numerous fragrant, white to pale yellow blooms. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-draining soil. Angraecum robustum is notable for its ability to climb using its aerial roots, making it a striking addition to tropical gardens.
